meanings.definition: The action or practice of deceiving someone by concealing or misrepresenting the truth.
meanings.sent1: Her deceit was uncovered when the truth came out.
meanings.sent2: The deceit in his words made it hard to trust him.
meanings.sent3: The magician's deceit with the disappearing act amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The deceit of the shadows made the room seem darker than it was.
meanings.sent5: The deceit in the mirror made her reflection appear distorted.

meanings.definition: The quality of being deceitful; untrustworthiness.
meanings.sent1: His deceit was evident in the way he avoided eye contact.
meanings.sent2: The politician's deceit was revealed through leaked documents.
meanings.sent3: The cat's deceit in pretending to be asleep fooled the dog.
meanings.sent4: The deceit of the storm clouds foretold a heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The deceit of the mask hid his true emotions.
